channel.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
channel.description: Hello all. I am trying to find out if it is possible to have a webclient that is compatible with Macs and Windows. I figured being as you can play runescape via mac and pc on the web then it must be a webclient so there is someway to make one. If you know of such a way please post, or make a guide and we can get it stickied. I belive this would further enhance RSPS's because they wouldnt be limited to PCs :D

item.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Meeper98:

System.getProperty(“user.home”)

  • “/.cache_name/”;

Otherwise it mucks up the home folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
item.dc:creator: @ravens ravens
item.description:
@ravens wrote:

java by definition is multi platform, your server does not work because it is set to download the cache to C:/ which does not exist on mac. in signlink.java or your equivalent, you must find a way to detect the OS before the download destination is chosen

Read full topic

item.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
item.dc:creator: @oxygen1 oxygen-_
item.description:
@oxygen1 wrote:

Okay, well what’s the home directory?

Read full topic

item.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
item.dc:creator: @zygis227 zygis227
item.description:
@zygis227 wrote:

yes just cache set to home directory.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
item.dc:creator: @brandonscarinfo brandonscarinfo
item.description:
@brandonscarinfo wrote:

[quote=“owner robert12, post:5, topic:376390”][quote author=brandonscarinfo link=topic=472323.msg3454320#msg3454320 date=1293944667]
Hello all.
I am trying to find out if it is possible to have a webclient that is compatible with Macs and Windows. I figured being as you can play runescape via mac and pc on the web then it must be a webclient so there is someway to make one. If you know of such a way please post, or make a guide and we can get it stickied. I belive this would further enhance RSPS’s because they wouldnt be limited to PCs
[/quote]

it depends if you are running delta/bluurr. If so i can help you. I am a mac developer so I know how a mac works and how windows works. Webclients download the cache into your C: drive on windows. You need to make a method to detect a mac computer and download it into the user’s home.[/quote]

please if possible add me on msn
1st_pk_storm_rulz@live.com

Read full topic

item.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
item.dc:creator: @owner_robert12 owner robert12
item.description:
@owner_robert12 wrote:

[quote=“brandonscarinfo, post:1, topic:376390”]Hello all.
I am trying to find out if it is possible to have a webclient that is compatible with Macs and Windows. I figured being as you can play runescape via mac and pc on the web then it must be a webclient so there is someway to make one. If you know of such a way please post, or make a guide and we can get it stickied. I belive this would further enhance RSPS’s because they wouldnt be limited to PCs :D[/quote]

it depends if you are running delta/bluurr. If so i can help you. I am a mac developer so I know how a mac works and how windows works. Webclients download the cache into your C: drive on windows. You need to make a method to detect a mac computer and download it into the user’s home.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
item.dc:creator: @brandonscarinfo brandonscarinfo
item.description:
@brandonscarinfo wrote:

yes i get weird error when i try playing them on any mac. I do not understand why it is. If any of you could please tell me what i am doing wrong it would be greatly appreciated

Read full topic

item.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

Very possible I’ve played real rs on a Mac(at a friends house) and if dumb ol jagex can do it so can we

item.title: Mac+windows webclient-possible?
item.dc:creator: @xxxxxx_13 xxxxxx 13
item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

I’m not sure if i understand why a webclient wouldn’t work on a mac. I used to use some old apples a few years back with the mopar web client and it worked just fine. This is news to me that most webclients don’t work on macs. If made properly they should…shouldn’t they?

Read full topic
